metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JavaScript Function Parameters
A JavaScript function does not perform any checking on parameter values (arguments).
content.html: A JavaScript function does not perform any checking on parameter values (arguments).

content.text: Function Parameters and Arguments
Earlier in this tutorial, you learned that functions can have parameters :
content.html: Earlier in this tutorial, you learned that functions can have parameters:

content.code_html:
function functionName(parameter1, parameter2, parameter3) {
  // code to be executed
 }

content.text: Function parameters are the names listed in the function definition.
content.html: Function parameters are the names listed in the function definition.

content.text: Function arguments are the real values passed to (and received by) the function.
content.html: Function arguments are the real values passed to (and received by) the function.

content.text: Parameter Rules
JavaScript function definitions do not specify data types for parameters.
content.html: JavaScript function definitions do not specify data types for parameters.

content.text: JavaScript functions do not perform type checking on the passed arguments.
content.html: JavaScript functions do not perform type checking on the passed arguments.

content.text: JavaScript functions do not check the number of arguments received.
content.html: JavaScript functions do not check the number of arguments received.

content.text: Default Parameters
If a function is called with missing arguments (less than declared), the missing values are set to undefined .
content.html: If a function is called with missing arguments (less than declared), the missing values are set to undefined.

content.text: Sometimes this is acceptable, but sometimes it is better to assign a default value to the parameter:
content.html: Sometimes this is acceptable, but sometimes it is better to assign a default value to the parameter:

content.code_html:
function myFunction(x, y) {
  if (y === undefined) {
    y = 2;
  }
}

content.text: Default Parameter Values
ES6 allows function parameters to have default values.
content.html: ES6 allows function parameters to have default values.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
function myFunction(x, y = 10) { 
  return x + y;}myFunction(5);

content.code:
function myFunction(x, y = 10) {
return x + y;}myFunction(5);

syntax_highlighting.text:
function myFunction(x, y = 10) { 
 return x + y;}myFunction(5);

content.code_html:
function myFunction(x, y = 10) {
  return x + y;
}
myFunction(5);

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
function myFunction(x, y = 10) { 
  return x + y;}myFunction(5);

content.text: Function Rest Parameter
The rest parameter (...) allows a function to treat an indefinite number of arguments as an array:
content.html: The rest parameter (...) allows a function to treat an indefinite number of arguments as an array:

content.code_html:
function sum(...args) {
  let sum = 0;
  for (let arg of args) sum += arg;
  return sum;
}

let x = sum(4, 9, 16, 25, 29, 100, 66, 77);

content.text: The Arguments Object
JavaScript functions have a built-in object called the arguments object.
content.html: JavaScript functions have a built-in object called the arguments object.

content.text: The argument object contains an array of the arguments used when the function was called (invoked).
content.html: The argument object contains an array of the arguments used when the function was called (invoked).

content.text: This way you can simply use a function to find (for instance) the highest value in a list of numbers:
content.html: This way you can simply use a function to find (for instance) the highest value in a list of numbers:

content.code_html:
x = findMax(1, 123, 500, 115, 44, 88);

function findMax() {
  let max = -Infinity;
  for (let i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
    if (arguments[i] > max) {
      max = arguments[i];
    }
  }
  return max;
}

content.text: Or create a function to sum all input values:
content.html: Or create a function to sum all input values:

content.code_html:
x = sumAll(1, 123, 500, 115, 44, 88);

function sumAll() {
  let sum = 0;
  for (let i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
    sum += arguments[i];
  }
  return sum;
}

content.text: If a function is called with too many arguments (more than declared), these arguments can be reached using the arguments object .
content.html: If a function is called with too many arguments (more than declared), these arguments can be reached using the arguments object.

content.text: Arguments are Passed by Value
The parameters, in a function call, are the function's arguments.
content.html: The parameters, in a function call, are the function's arguments.

content.text: JavaScript arguments are passed by value : The function only gets to know the values, not the argument's locations.
content.html: JavaScript arguments are passed by value: The function only gets to know the values, not the argument's locations.

content.text: If a function changes an argument's value, it does not change the parameter's original value.
content.html: If a function changes an argument's value, it does not change the parameter's original value.

content.text: Changes to arguments are not visible (reflected) outside the function.
content.html: Changes to arguments are not visible (reflected) outside the function.

content.text: Objects are Passed by Reference
In JavaScript, object references are values.
content.html: In JavaScript, object references are values.

content.text: Because of this, objects will behave like they are passed by reference:
content.html: Because of this, objects will behave like they are passed by reference:

content.text: If a function changes an object property, it changes the original value.
content.html: If a function changes an object property, it changes the original value.

content.text: Changes to object properties are visible (reflected) outside the function.
content.html: Changes to object properties are visible (reflected) outside the function.
